summary: Email correspondence between US Attorney's Office and defense attorneys regarding the civil forfeiture matter related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The emails discuss service of process, representation of the estate, and communication with victim counsel.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matter, coordinating calls with prosecutors and accepting service of process.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate who was served with a subpoena in the civil forfeiture matter.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate who was served with a subpoena, with potential privilege issues noted.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Reportedly represents the Epstein estate according to victim counsel, with discussions possibly breaking down.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Attorney representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters, copied on coordination emails.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney who identifies Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein as representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters, maintaining a continuing role.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Government attorney from US Attorney's Office coordinating with defense attorneys about the civil forfeiture matter.

persons.name: Andy
persons.context: Government attorney from US Attorney's Office who was to be included on a call with Marc Weinstein.

connections.description: Both identified as attorneys representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters.
Both serve as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and were served with subpoenas.
Weinstein represents the estate for which Kahn is an executor, accepting service of process on his behalf.
Weinstein represents the estate for which Indyke is an executor, accepting service of process on his behalf.
Moskowitz reportedly represents the Epstein estate according to communications with victim counsel.
Weinberg identifies Weinstein as representing the Epstein estate and coordinates communication.

events.title: Subpoenas Served to Estate Executors
events.description: Subpoenas were issued to Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, in the civil forfeiture matter.

events.title: Coordination Call Attempt
events.description: Attempts to schedule a call between government attorneys and defense attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andy regarding the civil forfeiture matter.

events.title: Attorney Identification for Estate
events.description: Martin Weinberg emails to identify Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein as attorneys representing the Epstein estate in civil forfeiture matters.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 17th floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office was actively pursuing civil forfeiture proceedings against Jeffrey Epstein's estate in October 2019.
Subpoenas were served to estate executors Richard Kahn and Darren Indyke, with defense attorneys accepting service on their behalf.
There was confusion about legal representation of the estate, with Bennet Moskowitz also reportedly representing the estate and discussions with victim counsel possibly breaking down.
Communication between government prosecutors and estate attorneys was being coordinated through Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback.
